Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2008 08:24AM - edited Dec 27, 2008 04:34PM by Reneepals Lynn, Merry Christmas! Anti deppressants really helped me. I take Lexapro, without  God & Lexapro, I could not function. Really it helped me soooooooooooo much . I was scarred S---less 2 months ago , I could not look anyone in the eye and when I had time to think about my dx , my thighs were in so much pain from fear! Who gives a crappola about the hair. I can remember how at 1st it was such a big deal.I was devastated. But now looking back in retrospect. Whats the alternative? I'll take the loss of hair any day. Beside doing funky things with scarves, hats and wigs it was pretty cool  (not the chemo) and believe it or not my darling husband thought I looked the best bald. Hearing from you about how your husband is with you, I am sure he was ok with it then and will be ok with it now. (believe me I pray for you to keep you hair). I have to use a heating blanket sometimes for my rib mets and it works, its weird I have mets on my rib in the back, but I get referred pain under my breast, freaky. Anyway try heat, it works. If it really really hurts I'l take Tylenol and if that doesn't work I'll take a Vicoden. But for the most part I really do not have to take alot of pain meds. Thats because of the praying.Also a big must , remember to use Udder Butter on your feet. The A.I's have dried my skin out and I slather (If that is even a word) it on my feet , put heavy cotton socks on and your good to go. Do it from the start of chemo, this way you do not get the cracked heals, be proactive on that! I remember how the chemo really tried to tear my heals up, the Udder Butter was a life saver.They say biotin helps wiith the nails and hair , I do not know to much about that. So check it out with your Onc. Well I  have been very long winded, I am so sorry....hehehehehehe Have a very Merry Christmas &  May 2009 be your best year yet!

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2009 08:02PM - edited Jul 17, 2009 08:03PM by Reneepals Hello Ms Luann..... I am some where in the same boat as you. As you know my Petscan lit up a little on my liver, but on the ctscan there is nothing there that anatomincally corresponds with the uptake...hmmmmmmmmmmmm... well my tumor marker came back for my Cea and it is down another 15 points from 65. hmmmmmmmmm again. I went to see my onc today. She feels that there is no evidence of progression, she also spoke with the radiologist, who also felt that the results are inconclusive with the info we have. Everything is contradicting.  Also I was told that Petscans have a 20 percent false positive rate.....Ho hummmmmmmmmmmm..Well after much discussion, we have decided to stay on the Femara, Zometa & Lupron. We are also going to do another Petscan/ Ctscan in 2 months instead of three. It takes alot to make decisions like these. But if you and your onc agree on what course to take. Go with your gut and a little expert opinion. I just looked at my onc at one point and she looked at me and said," Your doing great, it's going to be ok, we just have to stay 20 steps ahead of this, but I do not feel comfortable with changing a treatment that is working". Save big guns for much later, that's my feeling. Chemo really left me with residual neuropathy. If we can avoid this, why not? Luv you Luann and I wish, I had the answers... Dang! you have been so helpful and I can't even return the favor. I pray you find your answers Hugs

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2009 05:24AM - edited Jul 1, 2009 05:41AM by Reneepals Jill, As long as we get good results from the Hormonals, I'll do them. I have been on Femara for 8 months now and my liver met? Gone! (per Petscan @ 6 months) I am praying to God for years and years!  I to am very grateful to forgo chemo. It's all what your comfortable with. Just a note my tumor was also highly Er & Pr positive. What was really strange to my Onc and got her very excited is that my pain almost immediatley vanished when I started taking Femara.  The s.e. are no where as bad as chemo (had it when first dx'd in 2006) But truthfully, I have alot of pain from joint issues, which now is subsiding. I work full-time and only go to the gym twice a week. I walk usually 3 times a week. So my quality of life is very good!....... I have had a weight gain of 30 pounds and it is because of Lupron I am told........... But I am ALIVE.... So in the big scheme of things not a big deal. Hope I was of some help,

Posts.Content: May 11, 2009 10:15AM - edited May 11, 2009 10:35AM by Reneepals I took my Stella for her walk down by the beach yesterday without the hubby. Big mistake. Two BIG Newfoundland's (SP) attacked us. So strange they are usually very big goofy firendly dogs. But they attacked like mad pit bull's. The owner didn't have them leashed and someone behind me called them. Well the look on the owner's face was oh SH**. He knew something wasn't right. All of a sudden they started galloping toward me. I started screaming and tryed to grab Stella. But there wasn't enough time. One of them came up behind me and the owner was able to control him. But the other one got a hold of Stella by the neck and was thashing her around like a rag doll. She screamed like a baby. I don't know what happened to me but, I just started stomping on this dog,right on his shoulder and his neck area. He dropped my baby and I picked her up and she was in complete shock, wouldn't move. The owner was so upset he kept on asking if she was ok and children were crying. But miraculously there was not a mark on her, no skin break nothing. My hubby is with her now, but when I get home from work, I am taking her right back down there. I do not want a squirrly dog. My poor baby!

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2009 08:10PM - edited Apr 2, 2009 08:11PM by Reneepals Sue, I think it has a lot to do with the stress you are experiencing in your personal life. I know that if it were me in your shoes, I would probably handle it exactly like you have. Quietly waiting & wondering. You can't just hold in stress and not get depressed. Seriously , I think stress had a lot to do with why, I got Breast cancer in the first place. You would not believe the  drama, I had in my life (if I could write a book)........ To get back to you! You say that you are sleeping a lot more than usual, that is the number #1 sign of depression. You definitely might have a need to talk with someone and/or get meds. If you need to talk we are here. hugs

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2009 02:17PM - edited Oct 5, 2009 02:21PM by Reneepals It's all well and good that you guys are going by old stats. See I think most of us ladies know that we are in a brutal battle, that this could kill us. But to be so hard on someone who wants to believe there is a chance she can out live your stats, is just plain mean. I am one of those ladies who wants to hope, wish, and deny, if it gets me through the course of all my pain, physical and mental, its not anyone's job to tell me no matter what, that I am going to die........... Yeah maybe I should just think the worst, stop fighting and just go die for statistics sake. For the most part, I used to come here all the time. But the make-up of the stage 4 thread had changed. I find it very cynical and it was never, never that way before.  A lot of the "Old Timers" are lurking. I miss them and their advice. Tontoandme, my onc tells me that she has patients 10 & 15 yrs out with Liver mets. she would not lie for my sake. She is the director of the breast center that I go to. She is a research scientist who in charge of quite a few clinical trials. I am sure she is not lying to me to make me feel better. Her reputation is very important to her and the hospital. You keep hoping and praying. Cause I am right there with you.

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2010 03:24PM Reneepals wrote: Patti... If your are still premenopausal they will either remove the ovaries or chemically shut  you down (Lupron). Femara is a little yellow pill that performs huge miracles. It cleared up mets to my Liver. You will probably get Zometa for your bones. It is not a chemo. It repairs damage done by the cancer and it helps make them strong. Only side effects from Femara that I had? Muscle pain & cramps ( a little bone pain too) but it does lessen with time. Sometimes it does come back, but you learn to live with it and rest & relax when your having a bad day. I can only speak for my self, it's what I do.

I usually get my infusion on Friday so when it hits me on Sunday, I can just laze around all day  which I have no problem doing. I am good to go back to work on Monday.

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2009 08:55AM - edited Aug 11, 2009 08:58AM by Reneepals Heidi, When I read this post, I immediatley started googling everything I could about Leptomeningeal Disease. You can do this. Your going to MSK one of the best Hospitals in the country. I really hate when docs give us an expiration date. Only god knows. I just got done reading all the posts here and there are a few ladies who have responded very well to treatment. I hear and understand your despair. Our children & families are the other victims of Cancer. It breaks our children & spouses down. It bothers me how they are forced to deal with losing us. Sure we know how frightening it is to face death. But I can only imagine the pain and fears our families go through. Heidi, I will continue to keep praying for you & your family. The only advice I can give is to get your head as "right" as you can, surround yourself with your children & family. I find that it is the only time I am truly happy. Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2009 02:03PM Reneepals wrote: Hi,  Liver  & bone mets. I am currently treating with Lupron (shut down ovaries), Zometa (bones) and Femara (A.I. aka Hormonal Therapy). It took about 5 month's, but my liver is clean and the lesion on my rib is healing. (10 months out) This really isn't an "easier therapy" just not as toxic. The pain from the A.I's is really bad, although it does lessen with time. Do not think that just because your mom is not getting chemo , she is not getting the gold standard of treatment. Reading post's on these board's, I have noticed and this is only my opinion. That treatment standard depend's on where in the country you are, what type of hospital you go to get your treatment or if you get it at a oncologist's office. There are a lot of different factor's that go into a Oncologist recommending the treatment that is good for you.

A good friend of mine actually gets pissed off when she calls at 7:00 p.m. and I am in for the night. She gets all nutty and will say "Your really going to bed? Are you kidding me?" This sunday I was determined to plant my garden. It took me a very long time, the 100 degree weather didn't help. I only got half of it in. The hubby only planted 2 tomato plant's yesterday and he has "nothing " wrong with him. So that should make me feel better. Plus halfway through planting, a friend called with alot of teenage/prom drama and I had to give her a ride. I could have continued yesterday. But I didn't. That's what is starting to bother me starting something and not finishing it. I totally get what you are talking about. I do have it good. But I think it is because I go with the flow and do what I can. I really want to start spinning, but I don't know if I have the stamina. PS. Thanks for posting this subject. This really is a topic that effects all of us. Is it lack of energy, stamina and endurance? Is it depression or pain?  That keeps you from doing these things? That would be interesting to know.

Posts.Content: May 19, 2009 01:13PM - edited May 19, 2009 01:17PM by Reneepals Kim, Femara's s.e. sneak up on you....... So watch for them. I have never considered them so life altering as people with stage 1 or 2 do. But, after all with stage 4 do we really have a choice? I have been on it a total of 6 months.  For the first month and the half, all I got was ferocious flashes. Now I get them only when, I really exercise and once in the while I  will get spontaneous flashes. Going into the 2 month the joint pain (Rheumatoid Arthritis) and my myalgia kicked in hard. I felt like a 90 yr old trying to get up out of bed. (A feat in itself) Well that is starting to go away. I have some hair thinning and weak nails. I really hope my hair stops thinning. But I had my scans last month and my liver is CLEAN, My onc considers me in remission! So Femara is super strong. My TM's bob up and down, but have not gotten over 85 on my CEA. My ca 2729 is 8. So keep praying and be very proactive in your health care. I will continue to pray for you. Hugs!

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2009 09:54PM - edited Jul 12, 2009 12:08AM by Reneepals Alice, Hmmmmmmmmmmmmm.....I don't think he is really being sneaky..... What is he supposed to do when you are away? Stay home and do nothing? I am not trying to make you feel like poo-poo.  I recently was on the other side of this issue. The darling Hubby went to a bike rally for 4 days. (I do not really like them) I saw this as an opportunity to do what ever I liked. Which meant, spa day, all day. I had a Swedish message, manicure, pedicure and facial. I then spent the rest of the time at the casino. My hubby had the nerve to be pissed. Can you believe it? He spent all his time for the last few weeks planning his getaway, which by the way was cool with me, then he had the audacity to get pissed?!!!!! When he finally realized what a bitch he was being he apologized. He told me he would have liked to have gone. I suggested we still could go.  I trust my hubby a lot and would not take away his "downtime", but I also expect him to realize, I will take my down time too and will not sit at home and not do anything while he is having a good-time. I do however totally understand about a party being thrown in your home, while you are away. Totally disrespectful and not fair. Cause we know damn well that they will not respect your house, not like if you were there! Men have a tendency to trash the abode. At least he was decent enough to consider your feelings and postpone the party. I think I understand why you got upset with "his" plans. We still want 'Our" plans. Thinking about this a second time, being stage four does take us off our game. Being totally truthful, I get scared sometimes, thinking about will he go on without me? It makes me misty, because I really do love him and don't want to have to think about things like that. Oh by the way did I tell you, I HATE CANCER! Well I hope I didn't piss you off  and by the end of my response...... I could definitly see your reasoning.

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2009 03:29AM - edited Jan 17, 2009 07:48AM by Reneepals 2muchlove, Reading your post with tears in my eyes, has brought back so many tender memories of the first time I was dx'd with breast cancer in 2006. My hubby ( who was my fiancee at the time) and I had just bought our new home. My Onc had insisted on me going on short term leave while going through chemo. My hubby could only go to the first couple of treatments because he was the only one bringing in a paycheck.  So my son Vinny stepped up to the plate and came to all my treatments and tests. He went through everything with me, the good the bad and the ugly. He saw things that a teenager shouldn't have to witness, but I was his mom and he wasn't going to let me go through this alone. His jokes, hugs, love, and compassion got me through some of the toughest times in my life. Because of this we have such a special bond. My Vinny is my rock. My oldest son David was totally devasted emotionally. He could not deal with my dx. He could not talk to me or look at me in the eye. He was terrified. He would distance himself from me to protect himself. Which was perfectly fine. No parent wants to put their children through all the pain and emotional terror that his disease brings. It kills us to see the terror in our childrens eyes. It hurts us knowing that our children are in fear of losing thier mom, when they should be thinking about going to college, partying with friends, traveling and just living life. Believe me, you being there for your mom spending time with her, laughing and crying means the world to her. You just being there is everything. This time around in my fight with the beast, my son David is completely different. He is constantly coming over , calling me, emailing me , asking me if there is anything he can do. Before he wouldn't even ask how treatment was, he would pretend I wasn't sick. Now he asks about test, treatment,etc...... He hugs me ( Hugs mean so much to me now ). I guess what I am trying to tell you is that, anything you can do for your mom or with your mom, will mean everything to her. The love you have for her will help her through this terrible journey, by knowing how much you love her and care for her. But at the same time live your life too, spending time with friends, have fun and good times. It is so important for you to have a life outside of the "Cancer". Believe me your mom wants this for you. God Bless Tender Hugs & Prayers

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2009 08:35PM - edited Apr 21, 2009 08:40PM by Reneepals Ellz, Your asking a lot of '"professional" question's. I have a couple of Amateur observation's. Your mom's cancer would be considered Breast cancer met's to the Pleura. ( It will alway's be breast cancer). There is no proof that having a Mastectomy vs. Lumpectomy is any better when it come's to metastasis. Also cancer doesn't necessarily met's via the lymph node's. As I am living proof, I had absolutely no node involvement, so it spread through the blood. Also I had clear margin's, I personally think I was stage 4 from the get go, it was just not detected anywhere else. Petscan's do not start picking up cancerous cells with minimal disease present. It look's like your mom is Triple negative, it sometime's can be pretty aggressive. I think her Onc is Horrible (but that is my opinion) If she is Her2-, Herceptin would have been of no value to her. Mom can also be followed by CT scan or MRI. For some reason my onc prefer's Petscan/CTscan. I hope your mom get's relief from her current treatment and it's never to late for a second opinion

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2008 01:44PM Reneepals wrote: Kelly, I found out the same week you found your mets, that I had liver mets, 3 small lesions & a lesion on my 9th rib. I was totally pissed off! What the f@#$. My fiancee of 9 yrs and I had just got married in Hawaii (dream wedding). Reason being we beat my breast cancer together and lets just do this for us. I was only doing a follow-up MRI on my kidneys and thats when they found the Liver Mets. I was Stage 1 er/pr pos her2 neg-.  I was bascically destroyed just like everyone else who hears crap like this. I was crippled with fear for the 1st week. I couldn't function, I went to get my pet-scan done & the next day I had a melt down on the phone with my Oncologist's assitant. I told her I was so sick & crippled with fear that I was practically picking out my coffin. The reason being I was on the stupid internet where they have us dead in 8 months. I was assured by her that they had many patients with liver mets living long lives and to stay of the internet! Jesus is the only thing getting me through this. I recieved my first lupron shot on Oct 31st and started femara on Nov 7th. Zometa will follow next months lupron shot. I hear good things about the femara from my oncologist. I am getting my treatment at Yale New Haven  & my doc is the director of the breast Center here, she came from Dana Farber , so God pretty much put her in my path. As we start our journey together, I give you lots of love & hugs and kisses and the power of prayer! Be well,  Renee "By his stripes we are healed"
